controlinterface.swinguiadvanced.view.other

Class SmartScroller

  • java.lang.Object
    • controlinterface.swinguiadvanced.view.other.SmartScroller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.AdjustmentListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class SmartScroller
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.AdjustmentListener
    The SmartScroller will attempt to keep the viewport positioned based on the users interaction with the scrollbar.

    Taken from https://tips4java.wordpress.com/2013/03/03/smart-scrolling/ (19.6.2015).

    • Constructor Detail

      • SmartScroller

        public SmartScroller(javax.swing.JScrollPane scrollPane)
        Convenience constructor. Scroll direction is VERTICAL and viewport position is at the END.
        Parameters:
        scrollPane - the scroll pane to monitor

      • SmartScroller

        public SmartScroller(javax.swing.JScrollPane scrollPane,
                     int viewportPosition)
        Convenience constructor. Scroll direction is VERTICAL.
        Parameters:
        scrollPane - the scroll pane to monitor
        viewportPosition - valid values are START and END

      • SmartScroller

        public SmartScroller(javax.swing.JScrollPane scrollPane,
                     int scrollDirection,
                     int viewportPosition)
        Specifies how the SmartScroller will function.
        Parameters:
        scrollPane - the scroll pane to monitor
        scrollDirection - indicates which JScrollBar to monitor. Valid values are HORIZONTAL and VERTICAL.
        viewportPosition - indicates where the viewport will normally be positioned as data is added. Valid values are START and END
